page.title: 20BLAGDON, CENTRE FOR TOURISM
page.content: Although we are used to Blagdon, we still think it is a very beautiful place. We are on the North slopes of the{Mendips,}which provide many super footpaths and pony trekking routes. The{Romans}used a route along the ridge of Mendip all the way to the coast at{Uphill}to transport goods for export to Wales and France. Until fairly recently tin and lead were mined up above the school at {Charterhouse. Blagdon Lake}is renowned for the quality of its trout and the guest houses are often full with anglers from all over the country. Although the village has grown in the past 15 years, the builders have been careful not to destroy the looks of the place, with its beautiful stone walls, covered in wild flowers, or shrubs. On the A368, Blagdon is a{must for visitors to the South of Bristol!
